alert.note: Alert for Chenango (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 08 at 1:53AM EDT until April 09 at 3:30AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Binghamton NY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New York... Chenango River At Sherburne affecting Chenango County. For the Chenango River Basin...including Sherburne...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chenango River At Sherburne. * WHEN...From early this morning to late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, The river begins to overflow the bank on the east side of the river. At 8.5 feet, Water spreads throughout agricultural lands nearest the river on the West side of Sherburne. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 AM EDT Friday the stage was 7.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage early this morning to 8.8 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon to 7.6 feet and begin rising again tomorrow morning. It will rise to 7.9 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
